qas.question: What was the number of Greek Cypriots on Cyprus in 1973?
What did the Cypriot government find was the Greek population on Cyprus?
What did the Cypriot government find was the Turkish population on Cyprus?
In what years did the Greeks conduct extra censuses?
Who was excluded from the censuses conducted by the Greeks?

context: Due to the inter-communal ethnic tensions between 1963 and 1974, an island-wide census was regarded as impossible. Nevertheless, the Greek Cypriots conducted one in 1973, without the Turkish Cypriot populace. According to this census, the Greek Cypriot population was <a0_0>482,000<a0_0/>. One year later, in 1974, the Cypriot government's Department of Statistics and Research estimated the total population of Cyprus at 641,000; of whom <a1_0>506,000 (78.9%)<a1_0/> were Greeks, and <a2_0>118,000 (18.4%)<a2_0/> Turkish. After the partition of the island in 1974, Greeks conducted four more censuses: in <a3_0>1976, 1982, 1992 and 2001<a3_0/>; these excluded <a4_0>the Turkish population<a4_0/> which was resident in the northern part of the island.
